page.title: 13THE FORESTRY COMMISSION (2)
page.content: The wood is used mainly for house building, pulp, pit props and fencing. For Christmas 1984 the Commission cut down 300 trees for the public to buy. The Commission plans to build a pier to take their wood off the island. The cut wood will go to the Irvine Board Mill where it will be made into pulp for the making of paper, card and other stationery products. On Thursday 25th April 1985, there was a forest fire at Kilpatrick. The fire started at 12.45 and was extinguished at 21.30. Firemen and foresters were on fire duty all night in case the fire flared up again. The fire destroyed approximately 30,000 trees covering 40 acres. The ground will be replanted in 1986.
